questions.question: You will not get the book ………………………… you make the payment in advance.
We have lived in this town …………………………. twenty five years.
questions.description: For is used with a duration of time.

questions.question: My grandmother died ten years ………………………….
questions.description: Ago is used to count back from the present.

questions.question: You won’t get well …………………………… you take the medicine.
Susie along with her children ……………………………. come.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with along with, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: When did you ……………………………. work yesterday?
questions.description: The first form of the verb is used after do, does and did.

questions.question: He ……………………………….. ill for more than a month.
questions.description: Perfect tenses are used with for and since.

questions.question: Yesterday …………………………. a holiday, I went to watch a movie.
One of the boys ………………………………… not submitted his work.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after one of.

questions.question: Neither James nor Sam …………………………… at the wedding.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after neither and nor.

questions.question: He provided …………………………….. with food.
questions.description: The poor means all poor people.
